contractabilis: <entryFree id="n10859" type="main" key="contracta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractābĭlis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">contractātĭo</orth>, etc., v. contrect-.</entryFree>
contracte: <entryFree id="n10860" type="main" key="contracte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contraho, <sense id="n10860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contractio: <entryFree id="n10861" type="main" key="contracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contraho</etym>, <sense id="n10861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing together, contraction</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10861.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contractio et porrectio digitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchii (opp. projectio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superciliorum (opp. remissio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umerorum (opp. allevatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a contraction, cramp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 255" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 255</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">without nervorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 191</bibl></cit>: bonorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">consolidation</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 155</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10861.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an abridging, shortening, abridgment, shortness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CONT" /> 4, 4: syllabae, <hi rend="ital">shortening in pronunciation</hi> (opp. productio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis (opp. longitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n10861.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: animi in dolore, <hi rend="ital">dejection, undue depression, despondency</hi> (opp. effusio animi in laetitiā), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 66</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 14</bibl>: animos demittunt et contrahunt; v. contraho, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
contractiuncula: <entryFree id="n10862" type="hapax" key="contracti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>contractio</etym>; <sense id="n10862.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">trop.: animi,</quote> <trans><tr>dejection, sadness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contracto: <entryFree id="n10863" type="main" key="contracto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contracto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. contrecto.</entryFree>
contractor: <entryFree id="n10864" type="main" key="contractor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contraho, I. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n10864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes a contract, a contractor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 5, 8</bibl>; cf. Cod. Th. 10, 6, 3.</sense></entryFree>
contractorium: <entryFree id="n10865" type="gloss" key="contracto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contraho</etym>, <sense id="n10865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lace, string</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sfigkth/r</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
contractura: <entryFree id="n10866" type="main" key="contractu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.; lit. a drawing together; hence</etym>, t. t. in architecture, <sense id="n10866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lessening, contracting</hi> (of pillars), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contractus: <entryFree id="n10867" type="main" key="contractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from contraho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10868" type="main" key="contractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contractus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contraho</etym>. * <sense id="n10868.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A drawing together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acinorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a shrinking, wrinkling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10868.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10868.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An entering upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transacting of an affair</hi>: rei, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10868.3" n="B" level="2"> Jurid. t. t. (not in Cic.), <hi rend="ital">a contract, agreement</hi>: contractus ultro citroque obligatio est, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">suna/llagma</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes contractus, ut emptio, venditio, locatio, conductio, societas, depositum, mutuum, et alii innumerabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 88</bibl> sqq.: stipulationum sponsionumque, Serv. Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 23</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
contradicibilis: <entryFree id="n10869" type="main" key="contra_di_ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrādīcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contradico</etym>, <sense id="n10869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be contradicted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spoken against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Carn. Christ. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contradico: <entryFree id="n10870" type="main" key="contra_di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā-dīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, until the post-Aug. per. always written as two words, v. contra, I. B. 9.</entryFree>
contradictio: <entryFree id="n10871" type="main" key="contra_dicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrādictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contradico</etym>, <sense id="n10871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reply, answer, objection, counter-argument</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Quint. of judicial replications): ubi contradictioni locus non erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:48" default="NO">5, 13, 48</bibl> sq.; 7, 3, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <trans><tr>to anticipate the objection of an antagonist</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:163" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:72:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 72, § 1</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:42" default="NO">5, 13, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:17:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 17, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:38" default="NO">7, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 43 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contradictor: <entryFree id="n10872" type="main" key="contra_dictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrādictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>; in jurid. Lat., <sense id="n10872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who objects</hi> or <hi rend="ital">replies, an opponent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:11:27:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 11, 27, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:16:3" default="NO">40, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contradictorius: <entryFree id="n10873" type="main" key="contra_dicto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrādictōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contradictio</etym>, <sense id="n10873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing an objection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contradiction</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contrado: <entryFree id="n10874" type="main" key="contra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trādo</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to deliver together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> 11 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contraeo: <entryFree id="n10875" type="main" key="contra^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contră-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n10875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to go against, to oppose, make resistance</hi> (late Lat.; earlier written as two words); with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 84</bibl></cit> ad Magnum.</sense></entryFree>
contrafactio: <entryFree id="n10876" type="main" key="contra_facti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā-factĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting in opposition, contrast</hi> (late Lat. and rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex. Apoc. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contraho: <entryFree id="n10877" type="main" key="contra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring</hi> several objects <hi rend="ital">together, to collect, assemble</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10877.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10877.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (syn. colligo; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. dissipo): quae in rerum naturā constarent quaeque moverentur, ea contrahere amicitiam, dissipare discordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes ex finitimis regionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes copias Luceriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia in unum locum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, B, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes copias eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus circiter LXXX. coactis, contractisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:811" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque ad colloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exemplaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muscas in manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 42, § 151</bibl></cit>: ii, qui in idem (collegium) contracti fuerint, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 34</bibl> (43), 1—</sense><sense id="n10877.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10877.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring about, carry into effect, accomplish, execute, get, contract, occasion, cause, produce, make</hi>, etc. (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid litigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 63</bibl></cit>: qui hoc <pb n="458" /> <cb n="CONT" /> mihi contraxit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">numinis iram mihi (arte),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum Saguntinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:42:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 42, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid damni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 41, 8</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam certaminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 26, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 34, 10 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitates ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 27, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam,</quote> <trans><tr>to incur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 24, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 27, 69, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saginam corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam valetudinis ex profluvio alvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: porca contracta, <hi rend="ital">owed, due</hi>, sc. <hi rend="ital">for the expiation of a crime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10877.5" n="2" level="3"> In the lang. of business, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to make a contract, conclude a bargain, to contract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem, rem cum illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 20, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tribuendo suum cuique et rerum contractarum fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex rebus contrahendis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contrahendis negotiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfinitas inter Caesarem et Pompeium contracta nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10877.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the sphere of business: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to have intercourse with, to associate with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil cum populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10877.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with the prevailing idea of shortening or diminishing by drawing together (cf.: cogo, colligo, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to draw close</hi> or <hi rend="ital">together, to draw in, contract, shorten, narrow, lessen, abridge, diminish</hi> (freq. and class.; opp. porrigo, dilato, tendo). </sense><sense id="n10877.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal omne membra quocumque volt flectit, contorquet, porrigit, contrahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmones tum se contrahunt adspirantes, tum intrante spiritu dilatant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contractum aliquo morbo bovis cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se millepeda tactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bina cornua (opp. protendere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 32, 51, § 101</bibl></cit>: collum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to wrinkle, contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia (opp. deducere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium digitum in pollicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contractum genibus tangas caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimo frigore solus atque contractus vigilabit in lectulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl>, prooem. § 4; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem (lunae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem (with summittere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <trans><tr>to curdle, coagulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 117</bibl></cit>.—Of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">contracto frigore pigrae ( = contractae frigore pigro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 259</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pigrum est enim contractumque frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida tempestas contraxit caelum,</quote> <trans><tr>narrows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 8, 33, § 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 38, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <trans><tr>to stop, check</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10877.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., archit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to narrow, make smaller</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tapering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyramis XXIV. gradibus in metae cacumen se contrahens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10877.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw in, lessen, check, restrain</hi> ( = certis limitibus quasi coartare et circumscribere; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. remittere, diffundere): cui non animus formidine divum contrahitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1219</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te rogo, ne contrahas ac demittas animum,</quote> <trans><tr>do not suffer your spirits to droop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">animos varietas sonorum (opp. remittere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: terram quasi tristitiā (sol; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. laetificas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut et bonis amici quasi diffundantur et incommodis contrahantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are made sad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 14</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus intellegitur, appetitus omnes contrahendos sedandosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cupidmem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 39</bibl></cit> et saep. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">drawn together into a narrow space</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">compressed, contracted, close, short, narrow, abridged, restricted, limited</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10877.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto contractioribus ultimis digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:95" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares contractiores habent introitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contractior ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>smaller</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:495" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus (with exiguus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus contractior et exilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 3</bibl></cit>: contractiora<cb n="CONT" />  spatia ordinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10877.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10877.13" n="1" level="3"> Of language, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">et brevis ambitus verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:162" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 44, 162</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contractior oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositum dicendi (opp. uberius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summissā atque contractā voce (opp. erectā et concitatā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:175" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 175</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: parvum opusculum lucubratum his jam contractioribus noctibus, Cic. Par. prooem. § 5.—</sense><sense id="n10877.14" n="2" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae studia in his jam aetatibus nostris contractiora esse debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas,</quote> <trans><tr>stinted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 20</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">angusta pauperies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>); <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense transf. to the person: ad mare descendet vates tuus et sibi parcet Contractusque leget,</quote> <trans><tr>retired, solitary</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 78</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contractē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">on a contracted scale;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assuescamus. servis paucioribus serviri, habitare contractius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 39 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contrajuris: <entryFree id="n10878" type="gloss" key="contra_ju_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā-jūris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. jus</etym>, <sense id="n10878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contrary to law, unlawful</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">para/nomos</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
contrapono: <entryFree id="n10879" type="main" key="contra_po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā-pōno</orth>, <sense id="n10879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no perf.</hi>, pŏsĭtum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to place opposite, to oppose to</hi> (several times in Quint.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. only in late Lat., and rare): non semper quod adversum est contraponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Mart. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10879.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā-pŏ-sĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">antithesis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:81" default="NO">9, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:102 al" default="NO">9, 3, 102 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contrarie: <entryFree id="n10880" type="main" key="contra_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contrarius <sense id="n10880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contrarietas: <entryFree id="n10881" type="main" key="contra_ri^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrārĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contrarius</etym>, <sense id="n10881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">opposition, contrariety</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 14, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contrario: <entryFree id="n10882" type="main" key="contra_ri^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrārĭō</orth>, v. contrarius, B. A. 2.</entryFree>
contrarius: <entryFree id="n10883" type="main" key="contra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contra</etym>, <sense id="n10883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">being over against, opposite</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10883.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10883.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., of places (syn. adversus): <cit><quote lang="la">collis adversus huic et contrarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contraria tigna iis (tignis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 47, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrario amne,</quote> <trans><tr>against the stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 12, 43, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:429" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 429</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 47, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contraria vulnera ( = adversa vulnera),</quote> <trans><tr>in front, on the breast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contrarias partes fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tignis in contrariam partem revinctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">. si pelles utriusque (hyaenae et pantherae) contrariae suspendantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrario ictu uterque transfixus,</quote> <trans><tr>by a blow from the opposite direction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 49</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class. in prose and poetry, </sense><sense id="n10883.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other objects. </sense><sense id="n10883.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">opposite, contrary, opposed</hi> (syn. diversus); constr. with the <hi rend="ital">gen., dat., inter se, atque</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10883.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus virtutis contraria est vitiositas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 67</bibl> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:49 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 49 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10883.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas honestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna rationi et constantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:11:46 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 11, 46 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium illi virtuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticitas urbanitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes bacchio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color albo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:471" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 471</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n10883.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes inter se contrariae Aeschinis Demosthenisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 223</bibl>; Quint. prooem. § 2; 1, 10, 6; 10, 1, 22.—</sense><sense id="n10883.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versantur retro contrario motu atque caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut bono casu aut contrario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum ex contrariis diversisque inter se pugnantibus naturae studiis conflatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <trans><tr>conflicting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 28</bibl>: actiones, <hi rend="ital">cross-suits</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 174 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo quā contrariae quinqueremes commearent,</quote> <trans><tr>going in opposite directions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputandum est de omni re in contrarias partis,</quote> <trans><tr>on both sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex contrariā parte dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contrariam partem adferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:215 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 215 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10883.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the opposite, contrary, reverse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10883.10" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">contrarium decernebat ac paulo ante decreverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ea rex vult, quae Thebanis sint utilia ... sin autem contraria, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum vitant stulti vitia, in contraria currunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: diversaeque vocant animum in <cb n="CONT" /> contraria curae, <hi rend="ital">in opposite directions</hi>, Verg A. 12, 487: <cit><quote lang="la">ut auctoris sortem in contraria mutet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contraria versus,</quote> <trans><tr>transformed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:179" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 179</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contraria earum (artium) ... vitia quae sunt virtutum contraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidentiae contrarium est diffidentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 49</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non diversa praesentibus contrariaque exspectatis aut speret aut timeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:75:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 75, 2</bibl></cit>: qui contraria Deo faciat, Lact. de Ira, 3, 3.—With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui contraria faciat quam Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 29, 13</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 8, 24; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 267</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10883.11" n="b" level="4"> As rhet. fig., <hi rend="ital">the antithesis, contrast, opposite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 19, 27</bibl>; Jul. Ruf. Schem. Lex. § 11.—</sense><sense id="n10883.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Adverb.</hi> phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">ex contrario,</quote> <trans><tr>on the conirary, on the other hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e contrario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ham. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 1, 5</bibl> (al. contrario without e); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely ex contrariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:18" default="NO">8, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO">10, 1, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 3, 39 al.—In the same sense, but more rarely, in contrarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 54, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per contrarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:8:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 4, 8, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8" default="NO">2, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:20 al" default="NO">28, 1, 20 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n10883.13" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10883.14" n="1" level="3"> Of weight: aes contrarium, <hi rend="ital">weighed against</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/rropon</foreign>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 12</bibl> Müll.; cf. Scalig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10883.15" n="2" level="3"> Of hostile opposition, <hi rend="ital">inimical, hostile, hurtful, pernicious</hi>, etc. (more rare than adversarius, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">contrariis dis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 70</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Averna avibus cunctis,</quote> <trans><tr>dangerous, destructive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 741</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">usus lactis capitis doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hyssopum stomacho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 11, 87, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (sc. perspicuitatem) quidam etiam contrariam interim putaverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>injurious, disadvantageous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit> Spald.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia imperaturo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <trans><tr>unfavorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe quos ipse alueris, Tibi inveniri maxime contrarios,</quote> <trans><tr>hostile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora litoribus contraria, fluctibus undas Imprecor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 628</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 293</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an opponent, antagonist; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3</bibl>, praef. 2.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an opposite direction, in a different manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera procedentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:31:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 31, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relata verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contrascriba: <entryFree id="n10884" type="gloss" key="contrascri_ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrascrība</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a countersigner, comptroller</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntigrafeu/s</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contrascribo: <entryFree id="n10885" type="main" key="contrascri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contra-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to countersign</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 324, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contrascriptor: <entryFree id="n10886" type="main" key="contrascriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrascriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contrascribo</etym>, <sense id="n10886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comptroller</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntigrafeu/s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">RATIONIS SVMMI CHORAGI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 579, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3209</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contravenio: <entryFree id="n10887" type="main" key="contra_ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n10887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to oppose</hi> (late Lat.); with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: humanis ratiunculis falsis, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
contraversum: <entryFree id="n10888" type="main" key="contra_versum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā-versum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n10888.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr></sense></entryFree>
contraversus: <entryFree id="n10889" type="main" key="contra_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā-versus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [verto] (post-class.), <sense id="n10889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turned opposite, lying over against;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africa promontorio Apollinis Sardiniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiranti Zephy. ro contraversa (urbs) Gumathenam contingit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contrāver-sum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary, on the other hand</hi>, = contra, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contrebia: <entryFree id="n10890" type="main" key="Contre^bi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Contrĕbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">in the province of the</hi> Carpetani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:33:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 33, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:4:5" default="NO">7, 4, 5</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Contrĕ-bĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contrectabilis: <entryFree id="n10891" type="main" key="contrecta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrectābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">contract-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contrecto</etym>, <sense id="n10891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be felt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">handled</hi> (except in Lucr., only in late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">contractabile et solidum corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8 al.</bibl></cit>—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contrectābĭlĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">contract-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">so as to be felt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 660</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contrectatio: <entryFree id="n10892" type="main" key="contrecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrectātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">contract-</orth>), ōnis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching, touch, contact</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10892.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">equae, vaccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam contrectationes et amores soluti et liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:3:section=18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 3, § 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10892.2" n="II" level="1"> In the jurists, <hi rend="ital">an illegal appropriation of a thing to one's self, stealing, theft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 31, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contrectator: <entryFree id="n10893" type="main" key="contrecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrectātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">contract-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thief</hi> (in the jurists), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 36</bibl>. § 2. <pb n="459" /> <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>
contrecto: <entryFree id="n10894" type="main" key="contrecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trecto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">contracto</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tracto</etym>, <sense id="n10894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to touch, handle, come in contact with, feel</hi> (class.; most freq. after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n10894.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10894.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum corpus aquaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 854</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes partes corporis inspectare et contrectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">membra mortuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium Demaeneti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: librum manibus, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>to meddle with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula vel cibos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: pecunias vetitas, Cod. Th. 9, 23, 1, § 2.—</sense><sense id="n10894.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10894.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch in examining, to search</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne feminae praetextatique pueri et puellae contrectarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10894.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch carnally, to have illicit intercourse with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum uxores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10894.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrectata filiarum pudicitia,</quote> <trans><tr>violated, dishonored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10894.7" n="3" level="3"> In the Lat. of the jurists, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate</hi>: rem alienam, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10894.8" n="b" level="4"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to take by stealth, to steal, purloin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:3 al" default="NO">25, 2, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10894.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to contemplate, look at, consider, dwell upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudare corpus et contrectandum vulgi oculis permittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente varias voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia et disciplinas philosophiae,</quote> <trans><tr>to apply one's self to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contremisco: <entryFree id="n10895" type="main" key="contre^misco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĕmisco</orth>, <itype>mŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10895.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to tremble all over, to shake, quake</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">totā mente atque omnibus artubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: toto corpore contremisco, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contremuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 835</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 761</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10895.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract subjects (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus in meā causā numquam fides virtusque contremuit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have never wavered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid contremescis senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10895.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to shake on account of something, to tremble at a thing, be afraid of</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non contremiscamus injurias, non vulnera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl>: periculum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem Italia contremuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contremo: <entryFree id="n10896" type="main" key="contre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to tremble greatly, to quake</hi> (rare): caelum tonitru contremit, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 413 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis horribili cum plagā torrida tellus Contremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1220</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contremulus: <entryFree id="n10897" type="hapax" key="contre^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., trembling violently</hi>: (luna), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 351, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contribulatio: <entryFree id="n10898" type="hapax" key="contri_bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrībŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contribulo</etym>, <sense id="n10898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anguish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl></cit> ex Isa. 65, 14.</sense></entryFree>
contribulis: <entryFree id="n10899" type="main" key="contri^bu_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĭbūlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n10899.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the same</hi> tribus (very rare), Inscr. Fratr. Arv. Marin. p. 43; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 873, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Gal. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n10899.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of the same religion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contribulo: <entryFree id="n10900" type="main" key="contri_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trībŭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n10900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to crush, bruise</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">capita draconum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:73:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 73, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum ipsorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 35, 22 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10900.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to afflict much, to crush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium Deo spiritus contribulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:50:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 50, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem contribulati abicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contribuo: <entryFree id="n10901" type="main" key="contri^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĭbŭo</orth>, <itype>trĭbŭi, trĭbūtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to throw together, bring together, unite, incorporate, impart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10901.1" n="I" level="1"> Of a part added to or united with a whole. </sense><sense id="n10901.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10901.3" n="1" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non Penëus, nec non Spercheïdes undae Contribuere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 231</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprios ego tecum, Sit modo fas, annos contribuisse velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodesse putat apibus vetustate corruptis examen novum contribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos (annos) tibi contribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 15, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 15</bibl> pr.: CONTRIBVTVS EX LEGIONE III. GALLICAE (LEGIONI), Inscr. Afric. ap. Renier, 1357.—</sense><sense id="n10901.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10901.7" n="1" level="3"> Publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to add, join</hi> a district, city, etc., to a people, government, etc., <hi rend="ital">to annex.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10901.8" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oscenses et Calagurritani, qui erant cum Oscensibus contributi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> Kramer ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10901.9" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phocenses Locrenseque ... iis (Aetolis) contribuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 34, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epirotis Ambraciam placebat adgredi, quae tum contribuerat se Aetolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 26, 2</bibl>: Uxiorum dein gentem subactam Susianorum satrapae contribuit,<cb n="CONT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in (agro) Gallico, qui nunc Piceno contribuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Urbana colonia Sullana nuper Capua contributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(regna) isdem quibus ademerat reddidit, aut alienigenis contribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To admit, bring into</hi> a league or union: <cit><quote lang="la">polliceri ... Corinthum contributuros in anticum gentis concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elei, nuper in Achaicum (concilium) contributi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 37, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Elei per se ipsi quam per Romanos maluerunt Achaïco contribui concilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 35, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.11" n="II" level="1"> Of several objects united in one whole. </sense><sense id="n10901.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring together, unite, collect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi simul plura contribuuntur, ex quibus unum medicamentum fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:27:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 27, § 1</bibl></cit>: utilius est ... contributa habere remedia, <hi rend="ital">to have them treated together in one place</hi>, instead of scattered through the work, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 15, § 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quondam pagatim habitantes ... in unam urbem contributi majores sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 30, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">una ex iis (urbibus) quae ad condendam Megalen polin ex concilio Arcadum contributae forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.13" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to dispose, arrange, classify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in octo tribus contribuerentur novi cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter frumenta panicum et milium ponenda sunt, quamvis jam leguminibus ea contribuerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unam cohortem eos (milites) contribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contributio: <entryFree id="n10902" type="main" key="contri^bu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrĭbūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contribuo</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n10902.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dividing, distributing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">debiti et crediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contributionem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:7:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 3, 7, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:30:section=8" default="NO">35, 2, 30, § 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10902.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contribution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contributus: <entryFree id="n10903" type="main" key="contri^bu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrĭbūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from contribuo.</entryFree>
contristatio: <entryFree id="n10904" type="main" key="contrista_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contristātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contristo</etym>, <sense id="n10904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an afflicting, affliction, grief</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pud. 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contristo: <entryFree id="n10905" type="main" key="contristo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tristo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tristis</etym>, <sense id="n10905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make sad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorrowful, to sadden, afflict</hi> (except in Caelius, perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10905.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: contristavit haec sententia Balbum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens ... non perturbatur nec contristatur nec timet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of bees,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10905.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10905.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the weather, light, colors, etc., <hi rend="ital">to make dark, render gloomy, to cloud, dim, darken, sadden</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster pluvio frigore caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 279</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirius ... laevo contristat lumine caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 275</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquarius annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram silvā super opacā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:427" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores (opp. exhilarare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10905.4" n="B" level="2"> Of vines, <hi rend="ital">to injure, hurt, damage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites caloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:20:1 al" default="NO">3, 20, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contritio: <entryFree id="n10906" type="main" key="contri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contero</etym>, <sense id="n10906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grinding.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10906.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10906.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">contrition, grief</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">qli/yis</foreign> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 30, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">59, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contritus: <entryFree id="n10907" type="main" key="contri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from contero.</entryFree>
controversia: <entryFree id="n10908" type="main" key="contro_versi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrōversĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n10908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> CONTROVORSEIS, C. I.
