level="5"> With the designation of the crime, error, etc., commonly in the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, more rarely in the simple <case>abl.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">de, in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque in isto ipso convinco non inhumanitatis solum, sed etiam amentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec duo levitatis et infirmitatis plerosque convincunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem summae neglegentiae (with coarguere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (supplicia) in convictos maleficii servos constituta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetundarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>: latrocinii, caedis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifestis criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis avaritiae criminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicti et condemnati falsis de pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere convictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>; Lact. de Ira, 17, 6; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">istius vita tot vitiis flagitiisque convicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pari peccato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 30, 83</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in homicidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in majore fraude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adfectatione imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid fecisse convinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convictus pecuniam cepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 8, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11025.4" n="II" level="1"> With things as objects, <hi rend="ital">to prove something incontestably</hi> (esp. as criminal, false, punishable), <hi rend="ital">to show clearly, demonstrate</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n11025.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inauditum facinus ipsius qui commisit voce convinci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 79</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">peccata argumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:33:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 33, 116</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum veris convincere rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 764</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec poëtarum et pictorum portenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem (with redargui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit> <cb n="CONV" /> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errores Epicuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod obicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (crimen) apud patres convictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 40 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicta (praedia),</quote> <trans><tr>proved not to belong to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 32, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11025.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil te didicisse ... nihil scire convincerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:3:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:14 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 14 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
convinctio: <entryFree id="n11026" type="main" key="convincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vincio</etym>, gram. t. t., <sense id="n11026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a connective particle, conjunction</hi>: veteres verba modo et nomina et convinctiones tradiderunt ... in convinctionibus complexus eorum esse judicaverunt; quas conjunctiones a plerisque dici scio, sed haec videtur ex <foreign lang="greek">sunde/smw|</foreign> magis propria translatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conviolo: <entryFree id="n11027" type="main" key="convi^o^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vĭŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to violate, desecrate</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 398 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conviresco: <entryFree id="n11028" type="main" key="convi^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vĭresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n11028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch., to grow green, become verdant</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">litus insertis arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:58" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conviscero: <entryFree id="n11029" type="hapax" key="convisce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-viscĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n11029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to incorporate, unite</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conviso: <entryFree id="n11030" type="main" key="convi_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vīso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (rare and mostly ante-class.), <sense id="n11030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to consider attentively, look at, examine thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia loca oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus res occultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 146</bibl></cit>: omnes saucios, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 398, 4</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 598 Rib.).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia loca candida luce (sol et luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 779</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=352" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 352</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convitio: <entryFree id="n11031" type="main" key="convi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vĭtĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n11031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to attack</hi> or <hi rend="ital">injure at the same time</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">si sternutamento fuerint convitiati (of epi. leptics),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convitium: <entryFree id="n11032" type="main" key="convi_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convītĭum</orth>, v. convicium.</entryFree>
conviva: <entryFree id="n11033" type="main" key="convi_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>vivo</etym> (lit., one who lives with another; hence), <sense id="n11033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who feasts with another, a table companion, guest</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n11033.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 120</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 235, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 19, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 7, 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 119</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum (Tantalus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 28, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11033.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: postquam conveni omnes convivas meas, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 37</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 16 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
convivalis: <entryFree id="n11034" type="main" key="convi_va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīvālis</orth> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">convīvĭā-lis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 6</bibl> Zumpt <sense id="n11034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> as var. lect. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6, 8</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 1</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>convivium</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a feast, festal, convivial</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): oblectamenta ludionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:37" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:29" default="NO">8, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:14" default="NO">8, 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25 al.</bibl></cit>—No <hi rend="ital">comp</hi>. or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi></sense></entryFree>
convivator: <entryFree id="n11035" type="main" key="convi_va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>convivor</etym>, <sense id="n11035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who gives an entertainment, the master of a feast</hi> (rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:37:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 37, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convivialis: <entryFree id="n11036" type="main" key="convi_vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. convivalis <sense id="n11036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
convivifico: <entryFree id="n11037" type="main" key="convi_vi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīvĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to quicken together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Col. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convivium: <entryFree id="n11038" type="main" key="convi_vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vīvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vivo</etym>; lit., <sense id="n11038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a living together;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a meal in company, a social feast, entertainment, banquet</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bene majores nostri accubitionem epularem amicorum, quia vitae conjunctionem haberet, convivium nominarunt, melius quam Graeci, qui hoc idem tum compotationem tum concenationem vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strategum te facio huic convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublatum'st convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodium tangere in convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam egit semper vitam in otio, in conviviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominum cum togā pullā (videre) ante convivium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornare splendide convivium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 47, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 301</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos convivia cantamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl> 29; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 71; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11038.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">company at table, guests</hi> ( = convivae): <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiam vinosa tuam convivia narrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 109, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47</bibl>. § 96; 28, 2, 5, § 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convivo: <entryFree id="n11039" type="main" key="convi_vo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vīvo</orth>, <itype>vixi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n11039.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To live with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 2</bibl></cit>: MECVM, Inscr. Marm. Pisaur. p. 42, n. 94; cf. Inscr. Marini<pb n="466" /> <cb n="CONV" />  Atti, p. 38.—</sense><sense id="n11039.1" n="II" level="1"> For convivor, <hi rend="ital">to eat, feast</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">banquet together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:31 al" default="NO">7, 3, 31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11040" type="main" key="convi_vo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. convivor <sense id="n11040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
convivor: <entryFree id="n11041" type="main" key="convi_vor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīvor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n11041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> access. form convivas, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 314, 17</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 89 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">convivat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> ib. p. 474, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. p. 21" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. p. 21</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 85 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">convivare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 2</bibl></cit>) [convivium], <hi rend="ital">to feast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">banquet with others, to carouse together</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 32</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivatum assidue duobus tricliniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11041.1" n="II" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">acc., to consume, eat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:8 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 8 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
convocatio: <entryFree id="n11042" type="hapax" key="convo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convoco</etym>, <sense id="n11042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a convoking, calling</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">assembling together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 15, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convocium: <entryFree id="n11043" type="spur" key="convo_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convōcĭum</orth>, a supposed form to explain the etym. of convicium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15, § 4</bibl>, and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 26</bibl>.</entryFree>
convoco: <entryFree id="n11044" type="main" key="convo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to call together, to convoke, assemble; to call</hi> (esp. for consultation, to arms, etc.; class.; freq. in Cic. and the histt.). </sense><sense id="n11044.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dissipatos homines congregavit et ad societatem vitae convocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipatos homines in societatem vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatores ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">principes Trevirorum ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenis philosophos in locum unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 51, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 55, 76, § 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populumque senatumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos militum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectos equitum ad concilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 9</bibl></cit>.—Also of one person: <cit><quote lang="la">me in vestram contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit> Zumpt (B. and K. evocaverunt); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos in colloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">convocat hic amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Noctem Noctisque deos, as if allies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:405" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 405</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11044.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper tace, dum ego mihi consilia in animum convoco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego de re argentariā jam senatum convocabo in corde consiliarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convolnero: <entryFree id="n11045" type="main" key="convolne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convolnĕro</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">convolsĭo</orth>, etc., v. convul-.</entryFree>
convolo: <entryFree id="n11046" type="main" key="convo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to fly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flock together;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to come hastily together, to run together</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11046.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">populus convolat, * Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 32: statim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:21:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa, in quā furiae concitate tamquam ad funus rei publicae convolant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 51, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cunctā ex Italiā ad me revocandum convolaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sellas consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: ad scholam, Cod. Th. 6, 27, 18.—</sense><sense id="n11046.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad secundum legatarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad secundas nuptias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 17, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convoluto: <entryFree id="n11047" type="main" key="convo^lu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convŏlūto</orth>, no <sense id="n11047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>convolvo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to whirl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll round rapidly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum omni exoletorum turbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 24</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 9, 2</bibl>, the true read. is conluctatus, Haase, Fickert).</sense></entryFree>
convolutus: <entryFree id="n11048" type="main" key="convo^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from convolvo.</entryFree>
convolvo: <entryFree id="n11049" type="main" key="convolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-volvo</orth>, <itype>volvi, vŏlūtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n11049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to roll together, roll up, roll round</hi> (first freq. in the post-Aug. per., esp. in Pliny the elder). </sense><sense id="n11049.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis semina convolvunt venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:200 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 200 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubrica terga coluber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 474</bibl></cit> (in acc. with Hom. Il. 22, 95: <foreign lang="greek">dra/kwn e(lisso/menos</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">rapta turbines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:67" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se venae arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:198 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 198 al.</bibl></cit>—So in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convoluti in semet dracones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 72, 92, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër ignavo globo torpet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:124 al" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 45, § 124 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes mare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>involved by inundating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 623</bibl></cit>.—Medial: pennis convolvitur Ales, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 44, 113.—</sense><sense id="n11049.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n11049.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fasten together, interweave, interlace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudo convoluta omnibus rebus, quibus ignis jactus et lapides defendi possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spartum convolutum osseis iligneisve conamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 7, § 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11049.4" n="2" level="3"> Of a written book or roll of manuscript, <hi rend="ital">to unroll and roll up</hi>, as one reads; hence, <hi rend="ital">to look over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem (historiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5</bibl></cit> (10), prooem. § 8.—</sense><sense id="n11049.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Gallograeciam quoque Syriatici belli ruina <cb n="COOP" /> convolvit, <hi rend="ital">involved</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 2</bibl>, the right read. is convellere).</sense></entryFree>
convolvulus: <entryFree id="n11050" type="main" key="convolvu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convolvŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>convolvo</etym>. <sense id="n11050.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A caterpillar that wraps itself up in a leaf</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/y</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 95, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 264</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11050.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant, bind-weed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convomo: <entryFree id="n11051" type="main" key="convo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vŏmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n11051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bespew, vomit upon</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.): mensas hospitum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 76</bibl>: maritum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convoro: <entryFree id="n11052" type="hapax" key="convo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n11052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to eat up, devour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convoveo: <entryFree id="n11053" type="gloss" key="convo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>vōvi, vōtum, 2</itype>, <sense id="n11053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to devour together</hi>: NEVE COMVOVISE, S. C. Bacch. 13 (v. Wordsworth, Fragm. and Spec. p. 172).—Here belongs also: convoti iisdem votis obligati, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convulnero: <entryFree id="n11054" type="main" key="convulne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vulnĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-voln-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to wound severety</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n11054.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo magis convolneraberis et confodieris, quia nescis praebere jugulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:35:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 35, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmam vitis falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistulas,</quote> <trans><tr>to perforate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 27" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 27</bibl></cit> and 115.—</sense><sense id="n11054.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicta mores et vitam convulnerantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 17:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convulneratus libidinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convulsio: <entryFree id="n11055" type="main" key="convulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vulsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vols-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convello</etym>, in medic. lang., <sense id="n11055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cramp, convulsion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 165" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 15, 60, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:55" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 13, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convulsus: <entryFree id="n11056" type="main" key="convulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convulsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vols-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from convello.</entryFree>
conyza: <entryFree id="n11057" type="greek" key="co^ny_za"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏnȳza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/nuza</foreign>, <sense id="n11057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, of two kinds: the male, <hi rend="ital">the viscous elecampane</hi>: Inula viscosa, Linn.; <cit><quote lang="la">called also cunila bubula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl></cit>; the female, <hi rend="ital">fleabane</hi>: Inula pulicaria, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 32, § 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 19, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coodibilis: <entryFree id="n11058" type="main" key="co^o^di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ŏdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n11058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., exceedingly hateful, detestable</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">haeretici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coolesco: <entryFree id="n11059" type="main" key="co^o^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏŏlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. coalesco.</entryFree>
cooperatio: <entryFree id="n11060" type="main" key="co^o^pe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ŏpĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">co-operation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex. Tit. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cooperator: <entryFree id="n11061" type="main" key="co^o^pe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ŏpĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint-laborer, co-operator</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 143, 1</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,025:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Joan. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cooperculum: <entryFree id="n11062" type="main" key="co^o^percu_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ŏpercūlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cover, lid</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 58, § 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cooperimentum: <entryFree id="n11063" type="hapax" key="co^o^pe^ri^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ŏpĕrĭmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>: personae, Bassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cooperio: <entryFree id="n11064" type="main" key="co^o^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ŏpĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>rŭi, rtum, 4</itype> (contr. form coperiunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 491</bibl>; cf. Lachm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 134 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 134 sq.</bibl>), <sense id="n11064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cover wholly, to cover, cover over, overwhelm</hi> (class.; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n11064.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11064.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Verb finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrsilum quendam lapidibus cooperuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 48</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 50, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas atque tenebrae maria ac terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 491</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:342" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 342</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 39, § 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se multā fronde (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11064.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coöperta membra pannis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1269</bibl></cit>; so Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pomptinum omne velut nubibus locustarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste lapidibus in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 119</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11064.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: fenoribus coöpertus est, <hi rend="ital">overwhelmed, buried in</hi>, Cato and Sall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:17:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 17, 7</bibl>; in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot, tantis, tam nefariis sceleribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiis atque facinoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: famosis versibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 68</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">onerare aliquem maledictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cooperor: <entryFree id="n11065" type="main" key="co^o^pe^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ŏpĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to work with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">together, combine, unite</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedicaverunt ubique, Domino coöperante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 16, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11065.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam fides coöperabatur operibus ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentibus Deum omnia cooperantur in bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 8, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coopertorium: <entryFree id="n11066" type="main" key="co^o^perto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏŏpertōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 77, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cooptatio: <entryFree id="n11067" type="main" key="co^opta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏoptātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>co-opto</etym>, <sense id="n11067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an election, choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Patres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a confirmation by the Senate of Senators nominated by the king</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 4</bibl>. <cb n="COPI" /></sense></entryFree>
coopto: <entryFree id="n11068" type="main" key="co^opto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-opto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n11068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> coop tassint, old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 64, 10</bibl>; contr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">copto</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 9</bibl>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 135</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elect to something, to admit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">re ceive into some body by election, to elect to an office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>, § 122; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit> and 11; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 64, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistrum equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes per collegia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem in amplissimum ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in collegium (augurum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in locum auguratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patricios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coorior: <entryFree id="n11069" type="main" key="co^o^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>ortus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n11069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to come forth, stand up, arise, appear, rise, break forth</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; most freq. in Lucr. and the hist., esp. Liv.; in Cic. rare, perh. only once). </sense><sense id="n11069.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi materiaï Ex infinito sunt corpora plura coorta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 408</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:414" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:838 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 838 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes pluribus simul locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de integro coörtum est bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foedum certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio intestina coörta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus omnium cum hilaritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 24, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1091" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1091</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere febrim calido fervore coortam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 656</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11069.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11069.3" n="A" level="2"> Of natural phenomena, storms, etc., <hi rend="ital">to arise, break out, begin</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 458</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 512</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:100 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 36, 36, § 100 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taetra nimborum nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:253" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 253</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of events, <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi naufragiis magnis multisque coörtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 552</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11069.4" n="B" level="2"> Of a hostile rising, <hi rend="ital">to stand up, rise, to break forth</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11069.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani velut tum primum signo dato coorti pugnam integram ediderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 37, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 60 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum libero conquestu coortae voces sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno in populo, cum seditio coorta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11069.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">coorti in pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nos Sarmatarum ac Suevorum gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in has rogationes nostras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 56</bibl></cit>, : <cit><quote lang="la">adversus quos infestior coorta optimatium acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coortus: <entryFree id="n11070" type="main" key="co^ortus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from coorior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11071" type="main" key="co^ortus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏortus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coorior</etym>, <sense id="n11071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rising, originating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris et terrae solisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviore coortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 672</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coos: <entryFree id="n11072" type="main" key="Co^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏös</orth>, v. Cos.</entryFree>
copa: <entryFree id="n11073" type="main" key="co_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūpa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>copo = caupo</etym>, <sense id="n11073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female tavern-keeper and castanet-dancer</hi>, who exhibited her arts in her ale-house (cf. crotalum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cop. 1</bibl> Heyne and Wagner: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae copas imitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
copadia: <entryFree id="n11074" type="main" key="co^pa_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏpādĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. cupedia.</entryFree>
copae: <entryFree id="n11075" type="main" key="Co_pae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōpae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kw=pai</foreign>, <sense id="n11075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Bœotia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Topolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">on the Copais palus, the large Copais lake, which was named after it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 29, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coperio: <entryFree id="n11076" type="main" key="co_pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpĕrĭo</orth>, v. cooperio <sense id="n11076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cophes: <entryFree id="n11077" type="main" key="Co^phes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏphes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏphen</orth>, <itype>ēnis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Copheta or Cophen), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river, a tributary of the Indus</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11077.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form Cophes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 20, 23, § 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11077.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form Cophen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cophinus: <entryFree id="n11078" type="greek" key="co^phi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏphĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/finos</foreign>, <sense id="n11078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:542 al" default="NO">6, 542 al.</bibl>; cf. Isid Orig. 20, 9, 9.</sense></entryFree>
copia: <entryFree id="n11079" type="main" key="co_pi^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>co-ops</etym>, <sense id="n11079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abundant power, wealth, riches, abundance</hi> (very freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n11079.1" n="I" level="1"> Of material objects. </sense><sense id="n11079.2" n="A" level="2"> Of possessions, <hi rend="ital">resources, wealth, supplies, riches, prosperity</hi> (syn.: divitiae, opes; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. inopia): pro re nitorem et gloriam pro copiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: divitiarum fructus in copiā est; <cit><quote lang="la">copiam autem declarat satietas rerum et abundantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiis rei familiaris locupletes et pecuniosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum copiane sit agri, vectigalium, pecuniae, an penuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:39:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 39, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: publicani suas rationes et copias in illam provinciam contulerunt, id. Imp. Pomp. <pb n="467" /> <cb n="COPI" /> 7, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfluere omnibus copiis atque in omnium rerum abundantiā vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 52</bibl></cit> and 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plenior ut si quos delectet copia justo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Si recte frueris non est ut copia major Ab Jove donari possit tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 838</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus omnium rerum abundabat copiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abundans omni copiā rerum est regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: bonam copiam ejurare, <hi rend="ital">to abjure property</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to declare one's self exempt through poverty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis copia narium ( = luxus odorum, Schol.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11079.3" n="B" level="2"> In respect to other objects, <hi rend="ital">fulness, copiousness, multitude, number, abundance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta copia venustatum aderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (librorum) habeo Antii festivam copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta copia virorum fortium atque innocentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta doctissimorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">magna latronum in eā regione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubicinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 93, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 511</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11079.4" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang. copia, and far more freq. in <number>plur.</number> copiae, ārum, <hi rend="ital">men, troops, forces, army</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11079.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis armatorum copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā copiā, quam secum eduxit, se hanc civitatem oppressurum arbitratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omni copiā eligere aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl>; Pompei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, A, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 2</bibl> Kritz; 61, 5.—</sense><sense id="n11079.6" n="(b)" level="5"> More freq. <number>plur.</number>, orig. of a body of troops as made up of smaller bodies; cf. Engi. <hi rend="ital">troops; the forces, troops</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">armare quam maximas copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias secum adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in angustum oppido nunc meae coguntur copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: cogere copias Brundusium, Cn. Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, A, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13</bibl>; 1, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 44, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11079.7" n="II" level="1"> Of immaterial objects, <hi rend="ital">fulness, copiousness, multitude, abundance</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11079.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quam tibi de quāvis unā re versibus omnis argumentorum sit copia missa per auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum copia verborum copiam gignit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 125</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: inventionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abundare debet orator exemplorum copiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta facultas dicendi vel copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo ubertas et copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. Sen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 6</bibl>; and so of <hi rend="ital">fulness in expression, absol.</hi>, copia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias eloquentiae ponere in medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Senecae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11079.9" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in reference to action, <hi rend="ital">ability, power, might, opportunity, facilities, means of doing a thing</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11079.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. gerund.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mi ejus facias conveniundi copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 90</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:520 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 520 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius inspectandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatis amicitiaeque conjungendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11079.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus in otio vel magnifice vel molliter vivere copia erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 366</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11079.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum copiam istam mihi et potestatem facis, ut ego, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:87 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 87 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11079.13" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque edepol facio: neque, si cupiam, copia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:98 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 98 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quam aliam quaerat copiam ac te deserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 22</bibl>.—So pro copiā, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi> one's <hi rend="ital">ability, as</hi> one <hi rend="ital">is able</hi>: volo habere hic aratiunculam pro copiā hic aput vos. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro copiā supplicare Lari familiari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona pro copiā portantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vehiculis pro copiā cujusque adornatīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 26</bibl></cit>.—Esp. with the implication that one can do little: pro eā copiā quae Athenis erat, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro rei copiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi funebres additi pro copiā provinciali et castrensi apparatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iudos pro temporis hujus copiā magnifici apparatus fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 6, 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11079.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Access to</hi> a person, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: quando ejus copia est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecrat, ut sibi ejus faciat copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>. <cb n="COPI" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11080" type="main" key="Co_pi^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōpĭa</orth>, <itype>ac</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n11080.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess of abundance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:60 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 60 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n11080.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An appellation of the town</hi> Lugdunum (Lyons), in Gaul, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 194</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2325</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, COPIENSIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 753, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
copiarius: <entryFree id="n11081" type="main" key="co_pi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. copia</etym>, <sense id="n11081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purveyor</hi>, = parochus (late Lat.), Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
copiata: <entryFree id="n11082" type="greek" key="co^pi^a_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏpĭāta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏpĭātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kopia/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n11082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grave-digger, sexton</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Cod. Th. 7, 20, 12, § 2; 13, 1, 1; 16, 2, 15, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
copiolae: <entryFree id="n11083" type="hapax" key="co_pi^o^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpĭŏlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. copia, I. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n11083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small number of troops</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
copior: <entryFree id="n11084" type="main" key="co_pi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>1. copia</etym>; milit. t. t. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 9</bibl>), <sense id="n11084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provide one's self abundantly with</hi> something: Romani multis armis et magno commeatu praedāque ingenti copiantur, Quadrig. ap. Gell. l. l., and Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
copiose: <entryFree id="n11085" type="main" key="co_pi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. copiosus <sense id="n11085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
